ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And said: "I am sick (of what you worship)!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He then said, “I feel sick (of you)!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And he said: "Verily, I am sick."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then he said: Surely I am sick (of your worshipping these).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and he said, 'Surely I am sick.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then said: Lo! I feel sick!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And he said: verily I am about to be sick.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And he said, "I am indeed sick (at heart)!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And he said: "Verily, I am sick (with plague. He did this trick to remain in their temple of idols to destroy them and not to accompany them to the pagan's feast)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and said: 'Surely, I am sick (of what you worship)'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:89] and said, ‘Indeed I feel [I will be] sick’, that is, I will fall ill.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then said: Lo! I feel sick!) so that they leave him alone.
